channel.title: Government urges under-16s to experiment with oral sex
channel.description:
A GOVERNMENT-backed course is encouraging pupils under 16 to experiment with oral sex, as part of a drive to cut rates of teenage pregnancy. Family campaigners believe that the course, called A Pause, is having the reverse effect by exciting the sexual interest of children.
http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/uk/article885612.ece

item.title: Government urges under-16s to experiment with oral sex
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:358236”][quote author=Frell link=topic=454742.msg3329796#msg3329796 date=1283384620]

There was something about this on MTV’s The hard times of RJ Berger.

Basically it was a purity school club and their slogan was “everything but sex”. But of course it turned out to be a code “Everything butt sex”, so basically it was an anal club to prevent pregnancy and remaining pure by not penetrating the vagina.

Because MTV is known for it’s true-to-life stories?

Anyway, you could still get pregnant with anal sex, it’s fairly unlikely, but possible.

Only if you whip it out like crazy and firehose her in the vag then yea she could catch a preggers.
[/quote]

That isn’t the only way, it could be an accident too.[/quote]yeah, like the sperm dripping out of her ASSHOLE and leaking into her VAGINA.

by the way, that ‘hard times of RJ Berger’ show is fucking hilarious

item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:45, topic:358236”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=454742.msg3332038#msg3332038 date=1283561765]
use a condom, you’re far less likely to get an STD. problem solved
[/quote]

Or don’t have sex and you are 100% assured of not getting an STD, or getting pregnant. Nothing else can give you that level of assurance. [/quote]Don’t drive a car and you are 100% assured of not getting whiplash, or dying. Nothing else can give you that level of assurance.

item.source: Government urges under-16s to experiment with oral sex

item.title: Government urges under-16s to experiment with oral sex
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Mopman:

Even if we concede that the most common way someone would get infected is through sex, we can’t imply that being married makes that risk go away. For a start you’re assuming married people are faithful, which is laughable. You’re also pretending that using a condom doesn’t dramatically reduce the risk of transmission, or that people didn’t have it before they were married.

A couple willing to get married will always top a couple thats just together to fuck. Usually when people get married they do get STD checks to make sure either of them dont have anything they might give to each other accidentally, and possibly harm the child they might want to have.

So logically, in a way you can say getting married lowers the risk, or better yet, reassures you both.

Read full topic
item.source: Government urges under-16s to experiment with oral sex

item.title: Government urges under-16s to experiment with oral sex
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Lothy:

The idea revolves around neither of you having it due to not being promiscuous (they’re both sexually transmitted, after all).

Not really. AIDS is only caused by HIV (its basically an umbrella term for the various things that can happen to you when HIV kicks in and makes you its bitch), for a start, so they’re not “both” sexually transmitted, its the same thing being transmitted. Lets not forget that it can also be transmitted in utero or by contact with blood.

Even if we concede that the most common way someone would get infected is through sex, we can’t imply that being married makes that risk go away. For a start you’re assuming married people are faithful, which is laughable. You’re also pretending that using a condom doesn’t dramatically reduce the risk of transmission, or that people didn’t have it before they were married.

Read full topic

awaiting mitb’s answer to this.[/quote]

item.title: Government urges under-16s to experiment with oral sex
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

I'm guessing back then a woman would basically be fucked if she had to support herself and a child alone.

^

Attraction is a trade off. A man sacrifices some of his survival value by taking care of her, for her reproductive value.

It’s why women have last minute resistance

The population boom since our tribal days has been much faster than evolution so we still have hard wiring in our brain that isn’t needed today. It’s irrelevant now, but back in the day a single pregnant women would have been fucked.

item.description:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:23, topic:358236”]http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/7947460.stm

“HIV/Aids is a tragedy that cannot be overcome through the distribution of condoms, which can even increase the problem” - Pope Benedict

The Catholic church teaches against the use of condoms and forbids followers to use them.[/quote]

Lets not revive this old debate again. Obviously they discourage them because using a condom means you are having sex, and you shouldn’t have sex before you are married. What is so hard to understand about that?
